page.title: 07DERELICT DOCKLAND
page.content: Liverpool first traded with Ireland importing hides etc. and exporting coal. Later trade developed with Africa, America, Australia and other countries. Liverpool traded in tobacco, rum, sugar, flour, fruit and played a large part in the Slave Trade. As ships became bigger Liverpool's first docks were abandoned and bigger ones had to be made. When container ships were developed the docks were either too small, too shallow or wrongly equipped and so they fell into disuse, silted up and became derelict. There is an increasing interest in redeveloping the docks and projects undertaken recently have included the Freeport, International Garden Festival, Albert Dock Village, the Maritime Museum and now, planned for the future, the Northern Tate Gallery.
